column4: and this rc.local is executed whenever ubuntu boots without any additional settings from me
i don't have to tell ubuntu to boot rc.local everytime at startup right ?
As long as the executable bit is set for it, it will run.
no.  chmod +x /etc/rc.local  #Or to just see:  ls -l /etc/rc.local  #should look like this;  -rwxr-xr-x
